title: [MRG +1] English typos on nilearn/decoding/space_net.py doc
[MRG +1] English typos on nilearn/decoding/space_net.py doc

text: Appart from my minor comment, all is ok.

@Naereen: you final version is even worse (sorry, my suggestion was not nice). Maybe something like this:
`
For the corresponding fold, each pair is composed of two lists of indices, one for the train samples and
and one for the test samples.
`
What do you think ?
Also, can you squash your commits into one ?

> Last try for the doc on cv_ attribute.

Thanks

> I don't know how to squash from GitHub's web interface, and don't really see the point of cloning, squashing, pushing..

The idea is to keep as much as possible a clean history of commits. Maybe you can learn how to use git from the command line along with github [here](https://help.github.com/articles/good-resources-for-learning-git-and-github).

@Naereen, I manually merged your branch. Closing.

Thanks !
Wow. That's a bunch of typos! Thanks for catching and fixing. +1 for merge.
@aabadie: your suggestion has been included, the c.-i. checks will pass again, after what you can merge.

- Last try for the doc on `cv_` attribute.
- I don't know how to squash from GitHub's web interface, and don't really see the point of cloning, squashing, pushing..
Will try to do this asap.
I think this should be rephrased. Something like: `Each pair is composed of two lists of indices, one for the train, one for the test`.
